ca.corefacility.gview.layout.sequence

Interface Backbone

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, GViewEventListener, GViewEventSubject
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBackbone, BackboneCircular, BackboneLinear

    public interface Backbone
extends GViewEventSubject, GViewEventListener
    Backbone stores the actual shape of the backbone, and how items should "wrap" themselves around backbone.
    Author:
    Aaron Petkau

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Backbone.ShiftDirection 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double calculateClashShift(SequencePoint pinnedPoint, double heightLimitFromBackbone, double width, double height, Backbone.ShiftDirection direction)
      Calculates the necessary shift needed for a rectangle centred at pinnedPoint so it is either just above or below (depending on passed direction) the height defined by heightLimitFromBackbone.
      double calculateIntersectionScale(SequencePoint pinnedR1, java.awt.geom.Dimension2D sizeR1, SequencePoint pinnedR2, java.awt.geom.Dimension2D sizeR2)
      Calculates the scale at which the rectangle R1 (defined by a pinned point, and a size) would not be overlapping rectangle R2 (defined by a pinned point and size) anymore.
      double findZoomForLength(double deltaBase, double length)
      Determines the zoom level where the on screen length for the base range deltaBase is equal to length.

    • Method Detail

      • translate

        java.awt.geom.Point2D translate(double base,
                              double heightFromBackbone)
        Translates the passed point to actual coordinates.
        Parameters:
        base - The base on the sequence.
        heightFromBackbone - The height to this point perpendicular from the backbone.
        Returns:
        A point containing the actual coordinates on the map, or null if any value was out of range.

      • translate

        java.awt.geom.Point2D translate(SequencePoint point)
        Translates the passed point to actual coordinates.
        Parameters:
        point - A point on this sequence's backbone to translate.
        Returns:
        A point containing the actual coordinates on the map, or null if any value was out of range.

      • translate

        SequencePoint translate(java.awt.geom.Point2D point)
        Translates the passed point into coordinates on the backbone.
        Parameters:
        point - The point to translate.
        Returns:
        A SequencePoint describing the passed point in sequence coordinates, or null if passed point is null. May return negative values for base if point is outside of backbone bounds (past sequenceLength etc).

      • translate

        java.awt.geom.Point2D translate(double base,
                              double heightFromBackbone,
                              double lengthFromBase)
        Translates (base,height) + offset (length from base)
        Parameters:
        base - The base pair value to translate.
        heightFromBackbone - The height from the backbone of the particular base pair.
        lengthFromBase - The length (in screen coordinates) from the base pair value passed.
        Returns:
        The Point on the screen representing this sequence point at the current scale.

      • getSpannedRectangle

        SequenceRectangle getSpannedRectangle(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D rectangle)
        Obtains the spanned SequenceRectangle on the Backbone of the passed rectangle.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - The rectangle to obtain a SequenceRectangle from.
        Returns:
        A SequenceRectangle which completely contains the passed rectangle (in the current zoom context). Null if passed rectangle is null.

      • getScale

        double getScale()
        Returns:
        The current scale the backbone is at.

      • getBackboneLength

        double getBackboneLength()
        Returns:
        The apparent length of the backbone, based upon the scale.

      • findZoomForLength

        double findZoomForLength(double deltaBase,
                       double length)
        Determines the zoom level where the on screen length for the base range deltaBase is equal to length.
        Parameters:
        deltaBase -
        length -
        Returns:
        The zoom level where the on screen length is equal to passed length.

      • getSpannedBases

        double getSpannedBases(double lengthAlongBackbone)
        Converts from a given length along the backbone to the spanned base pairs this length covers at the current scale.
        Parameters:
        lengthAlongBackbone - The length along the backbone to convert.
        Returns:
        The base pairs covered by the passed length (negative if lengthAlongBackbone is negative).

      • getMaxScale

        double getMaxScale()
        Returns:
        The maximum scale this backbone can support.

      • getMinScale

        double getMinScale()
        Returns:
        The minimum scale this backbone can support.

      • calculateClashShift

        double calculateClashShift(SequencePoint pinnedPoint,
                         double heightLimitFromBackbone,
                         double width,
                         double height,
                         Backbone.ShiftDirection direction)
                           throws BackboneCircular.ClashShiftException
        Calculates the necessary shift needed for a rectangle centred at pinnedPoint so it is either just above or below (depending on passed direction) the height defined by heightLimitFromBackbone.
        Parameters:
        pinnedPoint - The centre point of the rectangle to check.
        heightLimitFromBackbone - The height from the backbone that the rectangle should not clash with.
        width - The width of the rectangle.
        height - The height of the rectangle.
        direction - The direction to shift the rectangle in (above or below the height).
        Returns:
        The height from the backbone to add onto the pinnedPoint, or null if passed point is null.
        Throws:
        BackboneCircular.ClashShiftException

      • calculateIntersectionScale

        double calculateIntersectionScale(SequencePoint pinnedR1,
                                java.awt.geom.Dimension2D sizeR1,
                                SequencePoint pinnedR2,
                                java.awt.geom.Dimension2D sizeR2)
        Calculates the scale at which the rectangle R1 (defined by a pinned point, and a size) would not be overlapping rectangle R2 (defined by a pinned point and size) anymore. So at any scale value beyond this scale, the rectangles don't overlap. Assumes the passed sequencePoints (pinnedPoints) define the center of the rectangle width the passed dimensions.
        Parameters:
        pinnedR1 - The centre point of rectangle R1.
        sizeR1 - The dimension of rectangle R1.
        pinnedR2 - The centre point of rectangle R2.
        sizeR2 - The dimension of rectangle R2.
        Returns:
        The scale at which the two rectangles do not overlap anymore.

      • getBackboneLengthAt

        double getBackboneLengthAt(double scale)
        Gets the apparent length of the backbone at the passed scale.
        Parameters:
        scale - The scale to get the backbone length for.
        Returns:
        The apparent length of the backbone.
